alert.note: Alert for Addison (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 17 at 1:56AM EDT until further notice by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Vermont... Otter Creek At Middlebury affecting Addison County. For the Otter Creek...including Center Rutland, Middlebury...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Otter Creek at Middlebury. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7 feet...Creek Road and 3 Mile Bridge Road will flood. Water begins to threaten lower portions of businesses on Bakery Lane and a few homes on Seymour Street near the covered bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM EDT Monday the stage was 7.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 AM EDT Monday was 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 9.5 feet this morning. It will then fall just after midnight tonight. It will rise to 8.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.6 feet on 04/19/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 200 PM EDT.
